prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Simon Blackquill
Description: A prosecutor who excels at psychological manipulation. As far as psychology goes, he's kind of like my senior, I guess.
Character 1
Name: Taifu Toneido
Description: A rakugo storyteller of fifty-five years who is famous for his soba-based routines. He has two disciples under him in his troupe.
Character 2
Name: Bucky Whet
Description: My client for this case, and the fourth head of Whet Soba. He's still got a lot to learn about noodle making.
Character 3
Name: Nahyuta Sahdmadhi
Description: A prosecutor from the Kingdom of Khura'in. He's also known as the "Last Rites Prosecutor."
Character 4
Name: Geiru Toneido
Description: Balloon artist and her master's senior disciple. She has twelve years of performance under her belt.
Character 5
Name: Uendo Toneido
Description: A rakugo storyteller and junior disciple after Geiru. He has less experience than Geiru, yet he's become higher ranked than her.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: My attorney's badge. It's lost that "brand-new" shine, but that just shows how far I've come.
Evidence 1
Name: Backstage Diagram
Description: Diagram of the backstage area showing the location of the stage, the dressing room, and the yard. [caption] The door to the dressing room and the door to the yard face one another. When the door of the yard is open, the door blocks the view from the yard to the dressing room.
Evidence 2
Name: Crime Scene Report
Description: The crime scene took place in the theater dressing room. Master Toneido was found with his face thrust into a large soba bowl. Contains photos of the crime scene. The victim's dying message is clearly visible in them. Includes additional info.
Evidence 3
Name: Taifu's Autopsy Report
Description: The time of death is between 2 PM and 5 PM. The cause of death is suffocation. It reads: Time of death: May 12, 2 PM - 5 PM; Cause of death: Suffocation. Nothing was found in his lungs.
Evidence 4
Name: Whet Soba Deed
Description: Found in the victim's possession. It's the deed to the soba shop. The deed holder is Bucky Whet.
Evidence 5
Name: Invitation
Description: The invitation Simon received from Master Toneido to the show commemorating Uendo's name succession and promotion. It states that the show "Time Soba" was to be performed by Master Toneido himself.
Evidence 6
Name: Simon's Statement
Description: Simon's eyewitness account of the time of the incident. Simon's eyewitness account of the time of the incident. Includes additional info.
Evidence 7
Name: Karuta Cards
Description: Karuta cards in the victim's dressing room. They spell out "WHET NO 4." Karuta cards in the victim's dressing room. They originally spelt out "OWEN 4TH" as shown.
Evidence 8
Name: Taifu's Note
Description: A note thought to have been written by the victim before his death.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: From 4 PM to a little after 4:20 PM, when Shisho's body was found...
Person: Geiru
Testimony 1
Testimony: ...Simon and I were standing in the hallway in front of the dressing room.
Person: Geiru
Testimony 2
Testimony: Before Uendo discovered the body, the only person who had gone in there was Bucky.
Person: Geiru
Testimony 3
Testimony: Come to think of it, a little while before Bucky showed up, Jugemu was barking like mad!
Person: Geiru
Testimony 4
Testimony: I was in the yard, but the door was wide open, so I could keep watch on the dressing room.
Person: Geiru

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot: Evidence 1 (Backstage Diagram) states that when the door of the yard is open, it blocks the view from the yard to the dressing room. However, Testimony 4 (Geiru) states that she was in the yard with the door wide open and could keep watch on the dressing room. This is a direct contradiction because the diagram clearly shows the view from the yard to the dressing room is blocked when the yard door is open, meaning she could not have watched the dressing room from the yard.

prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:

Name: Simon Blackquill
Description: A prosecutor who excels at psychological manipulation. As far as psychology goes, he's kind of like my senior, I guess.
Character 1
Name: Taifu Toneido
Description: A rakugo storyteller of fifty-five years who is famous for his soba-based routines. He has two disciples under him in his troupe.
Character 2
Name: Bucky Whet
Description: My client for this case, and the fourth head of Whet Soba. He's still got a lot to learn about noodle making.
Character 3
Name: Nahyuta Sahdmadhi
Description: A prosecutor from the Kingdom of Khura'in. He's also known as the "Last Rites Prosecutor."
Character 4
Name: Geiru Toneido
Description: Balloon artist and her master's senior disciple. She has twelve years of performance under her belt.
Character 5
Name: Uendo Toneido
Description: A rakugo storyteller and junior disciple after Geiru. He has less experience than Geiru, yet he's become higher ranked than her.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: My attorney's badge. It's lost that "brand-new" shine, but that just shows how far I've come.
Evidence 1
Name: Backstage Diagram
Description: Diagram of the backstage area showing the location of the stage, the dressing room, and the yard. [caption] The door to the dressing room and the door to the yard face one another. When the door of the yard is open, the door blocks the view from the yard to the dressing room.
Evidence 2
Name: Crime Scene Report
Description: The crime scene took place in the theater dressing room. Master Toneido was found with his face thrust into a large soba bowl. Contains photos of the crime scene. The victim's dying message is clearly visible in them. Includes additional info.
Evidence 3
Name: Taifu's Autopsy Report
Description: The time of death is between 2 PM and 5 PM. The cause of death is suffocation. It reads: Time of death: May 12, 2 PM - 5 PM; Cause of death: Suffocation. Nothing was found in his lungs.
Evidence 4
Name: Whet Soba Deed
Description: Found in the victim's possession. It's the deed to the soba shop. The deed holder is Bucky Whet.
Evidence 5
Name: Invitation
Description: The invitation Simon received from Master Toneido to the show commemorating Uendo's name succession and promotion. It states that the show "Time Soba" was to be performed by Master Toneido himself.
Evidence 6
Name: Simon's Statement
Description: Simon's eyewitness account of the time of the incident. Simon's eyewitness account of the time of the incident. Includes additional info.
Evidence 7
Name: Karuta Cards
Description: Karuta cards in the victim's dressing room. They spell out "WHET NO 4." Karuta cards in the victim's dressing room. They originally spelt out "OWEN 4TH" as shown.
Evidence 8
Name: Taifu's Note
Description: A note thought to have been written by the victim before his death.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I noticed Shisho's dying message right away.
Person: Uendo
Testimony 1
Testimony: The stiff cards were right next to the stiff, you see?
Person: Uendo
Testimony 2
Testimony: Hey now, enough with the silly puns already! Hee hee!
Person: Uendo
Testimony 3
Testimony: Anyway, I got the meaning right away. I knew it must've been talking about Bucky!
Person: Uendo
Testimony 4
Testimony: That was the master's final message, left as he was drowning in soba broth.
Person: Uendo
Testimony 5
Testimony: It's so like Shisho not to write Bucky's name outright. "Plain and simple" wasn't his style.
Person: Uendo

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Uendo's testimonies (Testimonies 0, 3, 4, 5) revolve around the interpretation of the victim's dying message and particularly the hint that the message points towards Bucky (the client). He claims to have "got the meaning right away" and that the message was a subtle but clear reference to Bucky.

Evidence 7 (Karuta Cards) shows that the cards spell out "WHET NO 4." It also indicates that the cards originally spelled "OWEN 4TH," which directly refers to "Owen," the client Bucky Whet's possible real or formal name, and "4th" likely indicating his position as the fourth head.

These two are not in contradiction.

Evidence 8 (Taifu's Note) is thought to be written by the victim before his death. If the note contradicts Uendo's reading of the dying message — for example, if the note clearly names someone else, or if it indicates something different from what Uendo claims to have deciphered — that would be a contradiction.

Unfortunately, we have no direct content of Evidence 8 to verify if it contradicts Uendo's testimonies.

Looking at the testimonies, Uendo says: "The stiff cards were right next to the stiff, you see?"—possibly indicating that the cards were near the corpse.

But Evidence 1 (Backstage Diagram) states: "The door to the dressing room and the door to the yard face one another. When the door of the yard is open, the door blocks the view from the yard to the dressing room." This could imply potential line-of-sight contradictions if Uendo's statement or presence near the cards contradicts the layout, but there's no direct contradiction.

No direct contradictions are evident for most of these testimonies and evidences given.

However, Uendo's testimony says "I noticed Shisho's dying message right away" (Testimony 0) and "I knew it must've been talking about Bucky" (Testimony 3), implying he was present early on and directly witnessed the message.

Simon's Statement (Evidence 6) is Simon's eyewitness account of the time of the incident and possibly his observations during the incident. If Simon's statement conflicts with Uendo's claim of witnessing the dying message instantly, then that's a direct contradiction.

Hence, considering the prominent contradiction possibility regarding testimony timing and witness statements, the contradiction is between Evidence 6 (Simon's Statement) and Testimony 0 (Uendo's claim that he noticed the dying message right away).

Therefore, the pair of evidence and testimony that contradict each other is Evidence 6 and Testimony 0.

Evidence 2
Name: Crime Scene Report

Evidence 3

Description: The time of death is between 2 PM and 5 PM. The cause of death is suffocation. It reads: Time of death: May 12, 2 PM - 5 PM; Cause of death: Suffocation. Nothing was found in his lungs.

Evidence 7

Evidence 8

Description: A note thought to have been written by the victim before his death.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I was onstage until just moments before I went into the dressing room.
Person: Uendo
Testimony 1
Testimony: The entire audience was my witness.
Person: Kisegawa
Testimony 2
Testimony: But my performance was a huge bust. Not a single soul laughed!
Person: Patches
Testimony 3
Testimony: I'll never be able to live down how terribly I bombed during that very important show.
Person: Uendo
Testimony 4
Testimony: I think there must have been fifty, maybe sixty people in the audience.
Person: Uendo
Testimony 5
Testimony: The story I performed is called "Tokisoba" -- otherwise known as "Time Soba."

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Testimony 0 states that Uendo was onstage until just moments before he went into the dressing room, implying he was performing or actively involved in the show near the time of the incident. Meanwhile, Evidence 3 (Taifu's Autopsy Report) gives the time of death of Master Toneido as between 2 PM and 5 PM by suffocation. If Uendo was onstage just moments before being in the dressing room and considering the time of death, this testimony may conflict with the timeline established by the autopsy report if Uendo's presence or involvement in the dressing room is questioned at the time of death.

However, a stronger contradiction is between Testimony 5 and Evidence 5. Testimony 5 states that the story Uendo performed is called "Tokisoba" (Time Soba), but Evidence 5, the invitation, states that Master Toneido was to perform the show "Time Soba." The invitation specifically mentions the show was to be performed by Master Toneido, not Uendo. This contradiction is direct: Uendo claims he performed "Time Soba," but the invitation states that Master Toneido was the one to perform the show entitled "Time Soba."

Therefore, the pair contradicting each other clearly is Evidence 5 and Testimony 5.
